meanings.definition: The quality or state of being extremely unpleasant or causing great discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The awfulnesses of the situation made everyone feel sad.
meanings.sent2: The movie was full of awfulnesses that made it hard to watch.
meanings.sent3: Despite the awfulnesses of the rainy day, we managed to have fun indoors.
meanings.sent4: The awfulnesses of the news hit her like a ton of bricks.
meanings.sent5: The awfulnesses of the haunted house were etched in her memory forever.

meanings.definition: A feeling of extreme displeasure or disgust.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't hide her awfulnesses towards the spoiled food.
meanings.sent2: His face clearly showed his awfulnesses at the sight of the mess.
meanings.sent3: The awfulnesses she felt towards broccoli was comical to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The awfulnesses in her expression were like storm clouds gathering.
meanings.sent5: The awfulnesses in his voice made it clear he was not happy.

meanings.definition: The collective instances of things that are extremely bad or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The awfulnesses of the day included traffic jams and spilled coffee.
meanings.sent2: The awfulnesses of the party were endless: bad music, cold food, and rude guests.
meanings.sent3: The awfulnesses of the failed recipe were evident in the burnt smell.
meanings.sent4: The awfulnesses of the situation piled up like a mountain of problems.
meanings.sent5: The awfulnesses of the old building were visible in its crumbling walls.
